events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #6: Deep Dive with Watson Analytics and Visual Recognition
events.description:
Hello SG Bluemix-ologists, In Bluemix very first meetup of the year, we are excited to share with you more in-depth about Watson Analytics and Watson Visual Recognition. 



 


Watson Visual Recognition enables you to analyze the visual appearance of images or video frames to understand what is happening in a scene. Using machine learning technology, semantic classifiers recognize many visual entities, such as settings, objects, and events Watson Analytics session will be covered by Pragyan. You will learn how to leverage on Watson Analytics to analyze historical transactions of a bike sharing company and predict future sales. She will talk and give a demo about tools in Watson Analytics to do data exploration and creation of dashboard, visualizing the insights.  About Speaker Pragyan is currently working at IBM as a data analytics intern. She together with her team won the Bluemix Award category of Singapore Airlines App Challenge in October 2015. She is a student of Master of Technology in Business Analytics from NUS and has good understanding of both business and technology. She is skilled at two major differentials in the business decision making: critical analysis of the problem and effective management of the information.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Analytics.CLUB Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer
events.description:
Analytics.Club's Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer About the Event: Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer networking event is conducted every last Thursday of the month. This event will primarily focus on building networks to initiate good conversations on data science across different venues around the town. The monthly event will be Networking only mixer (Just plain and simple networking with no long sales pitch or knowledge sessions) envisioned to keep local data science professionals connected. You will use the opportunity to exchange contact information, seek opportunities, and connect with fellow data science professionals and build deeper connected networks. When: Last Thursday of the Month Time: 6:30 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. Location: CATO (237 south bridge road, Singapore) Refreshments/Drinks: Buy Your Own Drink/Meal 


Put name tag with following initials in circle (optional, for effective networking): a. (B) for Business Background  b. (C) for Coding Background  c. (S) for Statistician Background  d. (T) for Technology Background  e. (M) for Math / Modeling Background

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter -  Jan Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Singapore SQL Pass Chapter  is back after a short break :) We are very excited to have our first session as a Pass chapter on 28th January 7 PM. Topic / Venue and Agenda details provided below Agenda: Jan 28th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8:15 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari 8:15 PM to 8:30 - Break 8:30 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Nagaraj Venkatesan Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-12 (60) AV VTC Topic 1: Performance monitoring and Tuning Series: - Introduction to Performance monitoring & tuning - Perfmon Counters Abstract : Perfmon counters is the fundamental tool, used not just in analyzing and monitoring of SQL Server health, but also plays a important role in providing data for decision making processes, resulting in cost savings for organizations. The presentation would cover the key perfmon counters, data analysis, easy ways to configure perfmon counter(s) on the server(s). Presentation would also demonstrate how perfmon counters help in mapping performance behavior patterns with internal processes and help in identifying the root cause of the problems Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best Semi-Government organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database” Topic 2: SQL Server 2016 - Always Encrypted Abstract: "Always Encrypted" is one of the major features to be released in SQL Server 2016, which would change the way application data security is managed in SQL Server. The Presentation would provide sneak preview into the yet to be released feature and would compare how "Always encrypted" improves the existing security solutions available. Presentation would also explain the way "Always encrypted" achieves end to end encryption and would analyze the various pros and cons of the solution Speaker Profile: Nagaraj Venkatesan, a SQL Server enthusiast exploring SQL Server for the last 10 years. Working for NCS Pte Ltd as SQL Server DBA, Nagaraj maintains databases used by one of the busiest public facing applications in the city. He frequently blogs at strictlysql.blogspot.com and is a regular contributor sqlservercentral.com. Besides these, he also holds a Masters Degree in Computing from National University of Singapore Please send in your RSVP for a informative and fun filled session.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Talk.CSS
events.description: New year, new meetup! We try to keep our timing tight to make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes. Paypal are hosting and will kindly provide pizza. I've heard photo IDs work wonders at getting through building security. Flexbox Yap Hong Kheng@hong_kheng Data on SG CSS and developer community with D3 graphs Sayanee Basu@sayanee_ Responsive Typography Zell Liew@zellwk 5 Minutes on... Sass Chris Lienert@cliener

events.name: Come and learn how Neo4j and R works together.
events.description:
Presenter: Wesley GOI In this meet up, he will discuss the advantages of using Neo4j’s cypher query language to execute path centric queries. He will briefly describe how to manipulate the results using R and visualize the data using packages such as igraph, shiny and htmlwidgets. 


Bio: Wesley is currently a PhD candidate in NUS and uses Neo4j to model genetic networks describing complex bacterial communities.
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Parser Combinators
events.description: Have you ever thought about writing your own parser for something complicated? Perhaps some exotic markup or that new programming language you dream of inventing? Ever thought what the code would actually look like? If, like me, you imagine a horrible tangled mess, then this talk will open your eyes to a whole new way of thinking about parsing that fully embraces functional programming to elegantly build parsers from simple, composable building blocks. In this talk Ravi will discuss: - An overview of parsing techniques. - What are parser combinators? - Understanding default scala parser combinator api - Combinators in other languages - Performance of parser combinators This will be an interactive session with code examples for you to work on so please bring laptops with a working Scala development environment set up. Looking forward to seeing you all there.
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore

events.name: SARTS Monthly Meeting - January 2016
events.description: This is our first regular monthly meeting for the year, join us to learn more about Amateur Radio and our activities!

events.name: ArtScience Late- Resonance
events.description:
Thursday, 28 Jan
8pm
Expression Gallery, L4
Free admission

Fascinated by the idea of an expanding universe and the possibility of a multiverse, internationally acclaimed artist, Randolf Arriola brings you on a sweeping sonic journey this ArtScience Late. Behold the art of Live Looping, where rhythms and harmonies inspired by the universe and its infinite perplexities are created, mixed and morphed.
